Reviews.Title: “pretty good, except for indoor noisiness”
Reviews.Author: Frederieke
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the weekend of 23-25 May and found it ok. The location is great, close to the subway and the city centre. It is surrounded by lots of bars and restaurants, but in a quiet, dead end street so no problems with outside noise. The room looked newly renovated and it was clean. All the people at the reception were very nice and friendly. The only issue I had was with indoor noises. The floors are lined with a linoleum that looks like wood. It looks nice, but it makes you hear every step your upstairs neighbours make. In fact, it sounds like there are elephants living there. This was a bit hard to deal with. Not just at night, waking you up out of sleep, but also if you want to relax in your room before you go out to dinner. Another thing is the thin separation between your door and that of your next door neighbours. There is only a stile as a separation, so when your next door neighbours put their key in the lock and walking into their room, it sounds as if they were going into your room. You can also hear the A/C unit, but I always sleep with earplugs so that didn't bother me half as much as the stomping aroung above my head. So because of indoor noise I rate this hotel as average. However, I think that you will get the same with lots of small hotels in this area so I am not sure if this should hold you back in booking this hotel. I paid 64 euro a night as a special offer through Expedia. I would not be prepared to pay the normal price for this hotel. The room was small, about 16 sq. metres including bathroom, but clean. There is no storage for your clothes expect for 5 hangers built into the wall. The only other option is to lay your clothes on the higher shelves in the bathroom, but I found they looked a bit too dusty. I was staying on the fourth floor and looked out onto the dead end street and into the appartments of people living opposite, but I didn't mind that. The bathroom was small,which is normal. The water of the shower doesn't all fall into the lowered part of the shower. Lots of it falls onto the higher strip of tiles that leads the water straight to the bathroom floor. That makes it impossible to take longer than 5 minute showers, otherwise the bathroom gets soaked. The safe in the room didn't work but maybe that could have been solved, I just couldn't be bothered to ask.

Reviews.Title: “A Pefect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a central, safe and nice area. It is only 2 minutes away from the metro. However ,taxi is an other option as it very close to the city center only costing us €6, one night. The hotel is very clean and with very comfortable beds, could sleep all day in them. The hotel is in a cul de sac which makes very quiet , no noise at night or day. The staff where very help, polite and very patient. We were a party of three going to the rugby match, and this hotel suited our needs perfectly. This hotel is great value for money. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"A little hidden gem!"”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to Paris should be realistic about the standard of accommodation in this fantastic city. Do NOT expect standards like those in other European cities. It is an old city and this is reflected in the style of the buildings. Typical Parisien hotels are small and rooms accessed up narrow staircases. Often standards are far lower than we are used to and the room rates still high. With a 2 star hotel, expect to pay 3 star prices. I have had some awaful experiences with hotels in Paris and so i was a little worried about this booking as I had secured such a low rate! £50 per night for a double! I need not have worried! The Hotel Cite de la Rougemont is a real find. A little gem hidden away! Yes the rooms are small but have all recently been refurbished and have the real bonus of en suite shower rooms/bathrooms. The bedroom decor is modern and tasteful and the bathrooms clean and contemporary. There is a TV, hairdyer and phone in the room and all floors can be accessed by an elevator. The hotel foyer and breakfast room is still traditionally decorated in a typical Parisien style but this gives the building charm and warmth. The best asset are the staff who were all without exception lovely! All spoke good English and were helpful and informative. Another great bonus was the breakfast! 6 euros per person for a a typical continental offering. Fresh delicious baguette, croissant, jam, butter and cereals and fruit juice as well as a choice of tea, coffee and hot chocolate (a bonus if travelling with kids). You can just decide on the day if you want to take breakfast and dont have to book in advance. The breakfast room was never crowded and allowed a nice relaxing start to the day. It was far nicer and easier to take breakfast here rather than a local bakery. The hotel is tricky to find at first and is in a little side street that forms a sort of courtyard. It was lovely and quiet and yet a stone's throw from the metro and an array of restaurants, shops and bars including Galleries la Fayette and the Opera . Superb location for sightseeing and safer and more upmarket neighbourhood. I had my 8 year old son with me and felt safe walking back to the hotel at night. Overall, I cannot believe the value for money. If like me you want a central place to lay your head, clean, quiet and safe with lovely staff and maximum effort then look no further! I would definitely book again and make this my Paris base.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - clean.”
Reviews.Author: bengeorge
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean. The reception was always helpful. Smallish rooms but thats the norm in Paris. Quiet road and very peaceful hotel. Overall - good value. Only things it missed for the price was a kettle in the rooms and maybe a secure luggage room for when you need to leave bags on your checkout day.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: Yesmin M
Reviews.Content: For a 2 star hotel this place ticks more boxes than one would expect. I organised a group booking so had to book 3 rooms; 2 doubles and one triple. The rooms are all airy and very clean. The double rooms have large windows looking onto a small courtyard and the triple have a wrought iron balcony looking onto the quiet street. There are so manta restaurants to choose from and the metro is about 2 minutes away. The area is safe regardless of time of day and everything is within walking distance that it would be a shame to take the metro and miss out on the beauty of Paris. A definite good hotel whatever your reason for visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Al_paca10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for your Euros. It is tucked away in an alley off a back street and is a short (20 minute) walk to Musee du Louvre and many other attractions of Paris. The nearest Metro Station (Grands Boulevards) is just around the corner, although this is not the most ideal line for linking directly to key tourist destinations. Still it does connect to other Metro lines. Although the hotel is adjacent to a quiet street (Rue Bergere) there is a nice café (Café le Royal Bergere) across the road. The café has good, but not exceptional, food and friendly staff. The hotel desk staff we encountered were very helpful and had excellent English. A small (and glorious slow) lift services the six floors and the room I had was perfect. The bed was comfortable and the shower/toilet spacious and clean. In this respect the hotel was an improvement on the two other Paris budget hotels that I had previously stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Simple, quiet hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: channii70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in November 2011. The room was clean and nicely decorated with a small TV on the wall quite small as per other reviews but adequate. Room was quiet on a private road with no passing traffic. Plenty of hot water for the showers. Breakfast was croissant/bread roll with jam and cereal with tea/coffee and orange juice. Hotel very close less than five minutes to the nearest tube station which made getting around Paris easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and newly refurbished.”
Reviews.Author: Hannicool88
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from a 2 star hotel, so was surprised and very happy with this hotel. Its location is fantastic - right by the metro. The room seemed recently refurbished and the bathroom in particular was very nice. The lady on reception was also very nice. The "luggage room" was actually just the lobby, but it felt safe enough to leave our bags there. Highly recommended for a reasonable but very comfy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lksorhus
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself had our first weekend without kids for six years and we decided to try this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. We found the hotel to be fully adequate for our need: The room was quite small but very clean and functional and with a pretty spaceous and newly refurbished bathroom. The room faced the backyard and was very quiet! If you plan to stay most of the day at the hotel, I suggest you find a more expensive hotel with larger rooms, but if you plan to explore Paris, it is fully adequate. The location is perfect with walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Montmartre and Galerie Lafayette and even Chaps Elysee if you enjoy walking. The hotel offers an internet connection in the room for just 5â‚¬ per day. There was also a water boiler in the room for making tea and coffee. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, old building , pleasant reception staff”
Reviews.Author: rbalassae
Reviews.Content: poor experience at this hotel, I made a reservation via Internet and the charges for the room were done irreversibly before we arrived and not only used as a backup as is usually done in other hotels, the room for three was tiny and we were offered after arguing with the lady receptionist, an even worse room. Finally we staid here, and the other reception staff people were very pleasant and helpful, but we barely staid at the hotel, the area is old but had several small restaurants and pubs which gave the area some night life, but the whole neighbourhood is somewhat rundown. I would not return or recommend this area, unless your budget is very tight and are willing to accept this aspects.Make reservations way in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirt1010
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of September. It was in a great location with a lot of bars and restaurants. The people that worked there were very nice.The room was nice and clean. There's no AC, but I knew that going in. We were on the top floor and opened the windows at night, which worked well. The bathroom was a little small, but clean. All in all everything went well.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra_He
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. The location is great, almost right next to a lively street and a metro station but still hidden away from all the noise and traffic. We actually walked to Sacre-Coeur one morning! Our room was very clean and simply but still nicely decorated. Extra points for the bathroom - it was good-sized and there was plenty of space for your personal belongings! The view from the room wasn't the best, though, and there could have been more space for luggage. But hey, it's Paris! The breakfast is basic - croissants, baguettes, cereal and few beverage choices - but does the job. And I actually love the simple french breakfast, so it was perfect for me! As a whole, we had a lovely experience here. Paris is expensive, so it's not that easy to find a hotel this clean and in such good location for such great prices. Totally recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsnrub65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for three nights and found this to be an extrememly comfortable and quiet budget hotel in a great location. The rooms was clean and tidy and appeard to have recently been refurbished. The bathroom had a nice shower and big bath tub. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly and spoke English (my French is very poor). Breakfast was ok and better than expected for this level of Hotel. We slept well every night. Even though you are right in the middle of a big city, this hotel is located in a quiet back street that doesn't have through traffic. Was a little hard to find initially and the location confused the taxi driver but well worth the effort. Also less than five minutes walk to two Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Small, Clean, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: bbpeoria
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I planned a Mother/Daughter Trip to Paris in April, 2011. There were 17 of us in all and we stay six nights at the Hotel de la cite Rougemont. This really was a perfect hotel if her are looking for inexpensive, clean safe, and good location. We stayed in a triple (double bed with roll away), and although not a lot of room around the beds, the bathroom was actually quite large with lots of "cubbie holes" for our clothes, so it was great. The breakfast was included in our package deal and was simple, but good. You could have cereal, bread (awesome bread), and a croissant. If you are expecting an American hotel and food - stay home. We took the Roisy Bus from the airport - it drops off at the Opera, which is about one mile down the street (20 minute walk - not bad). It was only about $9 Euros (I think) per person and was great! It was nice to walk after such a long flight. The metro is just around the corner from the hotel (around the corner and down the street). There are like six exits off the metro and we found that "Sortie #4" is the closest one. There are stores near by and laundry a couple of blocks away. There is a TGV station just around the corner, which came in handy to get train tickets to the Normandy Region. Paris is such an easy city to get around in, but I do have to say my Michelin map (which is huge) came in very handy as every little street is marked on it. We did a lot of walking and lots of metro rides. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charm in 9th Arrondisement”
Reviews.Author: rayzel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip ever to Paris and were pleased. It is a 2 star property, but for E110 we had a decent, clean room and a simple breakfast of a roll, a croissant and coffee or chocolate. The owner, Veronique, was quite helpful in showing us how to navigate the metro and find the sites we wanted to see. In fact, everyone who covered the front desk was extremely pleasant and helpful. They also spoke great English to the 3 others in our party who spoke no French. This hotel is on a quiet private street in the 9th arrondisement within a short walk to 2 different metro stops - Grands Boulevards and Cadet. The 9th is a non-touristic area with lots of things to see, many nice restaurants and cute alleys to explore. We preferred it to the more touristy left bank Latin Quarter area. The restaurants were more authentic and catered to locals as well as us tourists. The room was far from fancy, but it was clean and the front desk even went to the trouble of getting ice from their refrigerator when we asked. We felt this hotel was a much more Parisian experience than staying in a chain hotel in a fancier neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jesterinoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a surprise, as it is located down a laneway off a quiet street, then the foyer looked old and tired, but then the room was really nice. I had a top floor room that was in effect a small suite with a slanted roof. The room had been recently renovated with a new bathroom and decor. The bed was a new queen size. The view was into an internal courtyard but allowed for some natural light into the room. High speed internet was included and the hotel had a relatively large lift which is always a bonus for Paris. The hotel was well located near the busy Rue Montmarte. Boullion Chartier seemed like a popular tourist restaurant but we ended up eating at the outdoor restaurants near Rue Cadet. There are some beautiful patisseries and other eating places near to the hote. This is a good alternative to the Latin Qtr. I would go back to the hotel and was good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for what we need”
Reviews.Author: turista_profissional
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay in this hotel, we need to stay just for one night in Paris, to rest from a long haul flight. I found this hotel had a very good location and the triple room was confortable, clean and also the bathroom was big for Paris standards. I really recommend this place for a nice, confortable in a budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what you need on a short trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: itsabigplace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Thursday to Saturday. It was conveniently positioned approx 15mins walk from Gare Du Nord, and only another 10-15minutes from 'town', by which I mean the main 'attractions'. I have been to Paris a number of times, and can honestly say this hotel is probably the best I have stayed in. This is primarily down to room size. Short city breaks mean you rarely spend much time in your hotel room, however I have been in some in Paris where standing next to your bed is hard enough. The rooms here were airy and spacious. The bathroom was small but functional, and rather surprisingly for Paris I could actually close the door - probably because it was a sliding door! The room was very clean, the bed very comfortable, and although anyone in the corridor could be heard, our stay was relatively peaceful, as was the sidestreet the hotel is located on. It is only a two minute walk to the nearest metro station, and there are a selection of bistros just around the corner if you dont want to venture too far. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast is basic, croissant and bread, cereal if you want it, but considering Paris has become much more expensive than what I remember previously we used this option on one of the mornings. There is somewhere to leave your bag(s), albeit in the dining room, but this is useful on a city break if like us you travel late/early. In short, this hotel did what I needed it to. I wouldnt describe it as "plush" or upmarket, just convenient and efficient, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: michaeljharrington
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de la cite Rougemont is, hands down, the best place we have ever stayed in Paris. The Hotel is located in a charming, real neighborhood off the beaten path of most tourists. It is near everything you could need or want (Chartier's is only two blocks away), but tucked down a quiet street that provides a tranquil buffer from the bustle of the lively neighborhood. The rooms are clean, comfortable and recently updated, and while small like most hotel rooms in Paris, there is ample storage and a clean very functional bathroom. The staff is simply the best: they went out of their way to make recommendations for dining, provide directions, offer suggestions on transportation, give impromtu French lessons and simply chat--and always with a smile. In short, they made us feel like people, not just numbers on a room key. The Hotel de la cite Rougemont is the place I will stay when I return to Paris. No question.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: JMHubbards
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the staff were helpful. It was reasonably situated (although a little difficult to find) and the room was the minimum you would expect and clean. The cost was inflated but this is exactly what you would expect from Paris and I don't think it was exorbitant. We did not try the breakfast (which cost extra) because there is so many other options in Paris. There is no wifi only cable access Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, well located, clean hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: vcampisi
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by the value for money this hotel represented. Small but well appointed room, with en suite and clean. Nice staff and cheap internet. Room only AU$130 per night - fantastic price. Definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: haystacks
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and good location. The reception staff were very helpful and all spoke good english. On the down side our room and bathroom were miniscule although our friends in the next room to us had a larger room so maybe we were just unlucky. There's nothing wrong with the hotel, it's just that I thought that the hotel was overpriced for its facilities. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast at 6 euros; 20-30 metres from the hotel was a good bar/bistro called (I think) Royal Bergere where the same croissant, jam, orange juice and tea/coffee cost 4.50 euros. The bar also served a reasonable value lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dragos68
Reviews.Content: Yesterday we came back from Paris and I have to write comment about this nice Hotel. I have been in other 3 and 4 stars hotel in Paris many times but this one was the best I have ever had. The rooms are very quiet, you hear no noise from the street, it is very clean and of course the service. Luis who works in the reception area and the Lady who owns the hotel make your entire journey easy. I would like to thank both of them and the whole stuff in the Hotel.Next time I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: 1013WesternRanger
Reviews.Content: We statyed for 1 night on a return trip to Britain from the south of France. Friendly, helpful staff were expecting us and gave us 2 connecting rooms on the 5th floor. Rooms were slightly small but very clean and tastefully decorated and both had balconies. The only negative aspect was the heat - even in April the rooms were very warm at night and no air conditioning. We had to keep the windows open and that meant we were disturbed by street noise, which was surprising considering the hotel is on a cul-de-sac. Apart from that the rooms were very comfortable and the breakfast was very reasonable at 6â‚¬, free for children. For the price we paid I would have expected air conditioning but the location is great for the shops, bars and restaurants on the Boulevards Poissonniere and Bonne Nouvelle.

Reviews.Title: “Well located in the centre of Paris - clean, comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Voyages60
Reviews.Content: Our group of Canadian French students has stayed in this charming, authentic French hotel for the past 3 years and it has always been a pleasure to lodge them in this hotel. It is well situated within walking distance of the Opera, shopping, Louvre, Seine, etc. The staff is patient to speak in French to the students and are welcoming to the group. Looking forward to our visits in the future! Corinne Thomson, Voyages Millefleurs Travel Inc.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and affordable”
Reviews.Author: aegisys
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in April. Good location near the metro, shopping, restaurants, and the opera. Finding the hotel was not difficult. The room was quite small. But not unexpected, given the low price. The bed was not terribly comfortable. The walls were thin, so we could hear our neighbors, which wasn't a huge deal, but may have been if our neighbors had been louder people. Overall, it was a decent place. I probably would not go back, but I was not dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: katsmeow55
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel close to metro (walk) and many cafe's which we loved. The staff at reception were very helpful, friendly and the rooms were small but very clean and upgraded. There was even a hairdryer in the bathroom and a great shower. Can be noisy at night if you leave the windows open. I can sleep through noise though. We loved it here. Close to everything and lots happening all around.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mariamria380
Reviews.Content: We have just got home from a trip to Paris. We stayed in the Hotel Rougemont. I wanted to write the review straight away as I was so impressed by the hotel. Our room was a quadrauple and on the top floor. It was immaculate, clean and newly refurbished, with excellent bath and shower facilities. We had maid service and fresh towels every day. Breakfast was included in the price and consisted of fresh croissants, rolls, cereal, OJ and coffee. All the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English. It is difficult to find a good hotel in such a great location, but we did. Highly recommended and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent time-great choice of cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: pankle
Reviews.Content: when we decided to visit paris we have been looking a hotel in the heart of paris, near to a metro station and people who can help us out with the lines of metro. I was sure that we would pay a lot. Although in a search I found this hotel and i immediately booked cause of its price. GREAT CHOICE FOR STUDENTS!!! we didnt pay a lot ( I mean almost nothing! 170 its not much for 5 nights),I impressed of the clean rooms, we didnt feel the cold at all( the heat was excellent). very closed to a metro station(its very useful) and people who loved to explain me every day how to get to the different monuments. thank you hotel de la cite rougemont! we had a wonderful time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie3298
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 1 night at this hotel. I was nervous about booking it based only on Trip Advisor reviews, so I was THRILLED to find that all of the good reports about it were true. This hotel is well located in the Opera district and very near a metro stop. We were able to take the metro from Gare du Nord to the hotel with no difficulty. Though we arrived early, our rooms were ready and we were warmly greeted by Veronique. This is not the Ritz so the rooms are not "fancy", but they were spotlessly clean, and the beds were comfortable. I can't stress enough how important that is to me! As noted by other reviewers, the hotel is on a little side street, so we didn't find street noise to be a problem. Veronique was very helpful, as was James, the night manager. One thing to note - the rooms do have internet access but it's not wireless. I had my iPad, not a computer with an ethernet port. I had a little emergency and needed access so James told me how to use wireless in the breakfast area. We will go back to Paris, and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “extra fee for internet and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: shortmartin
Reviews.Content: according to tripadvisor this hotel offers free wifi. it is NOT true: the hotel charged a fee for wifi and breakfast too!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but convenient location - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mariemc86
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to metro - not more than 5 mins away. Lots of shops, cafes and pubs nearby. Room was very clean and quiet, tv had all french channels. Only problems with service was the lack of free wifi and no kettle! Didn't try breakfast, plenty of choices in local cafes/grocery stores. Really enjoyed the stay though and the area was perfect for all sightseeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “don't neglect this 2* based on the rating - its ideal!”
Reviews.Author: pamsiva
Reviews.Content: recommended by tripadvisor reviews, we stayed at this 2* hotel. It is in a fab area of Paris - not too touristy, but lively with lots of cafe's restaurants and is ideally located to explore the city. very convenient to get to. extremely clean and newly refurbished room was small but reasonably sized for citibreak hotel. Didn't eat breakfast but hotel is near supermarket and nice cafes/creperies for breakfast. can walk to lots of attractions from hotel and do explore the arcades off the main street you will find lovely chocolate shops and boutiques. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Custo benefÃ­cio excelente”
Reviews.Author: brkjen01
Reviews.Content: Estivemos nos primeiros 4 dias do ano e como a famÃ­lia Ã© grande decidimos nÃ£o investir em hoteis. Pelo Tripadvisor encontrei este hotel que estava muito bem ranqueado. Acertei na mosca. Os quartos apesar de pequenos eram confortaveis e silenciosos. Cama confortÃ¡vel e limpa. Banheiro espaÃ§oso para os padrÃµes de hoteis de duas estrelas. Com muitas ofertas de restaurantes e supermercados ao redor. Uma quadra de distÃ¢ncia do metro. Para viajantes com low budget, recomendo.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: mike4kerstin
Reviews.Content: We travel to Paris quite often and finding the right hotel can be a bit of a lottery. Therefore we were delighted to find this one. It is conveniently located in a lively part of town, but tucked away as it is in a little cul-de-sac it is perfectly quiet. Rooms in Paris tend to be very small, but our room was a comfortable size and the bathroom even more so. The hotel was very clean, the staff friendly and the breakfast unexciting but perfectly adequate. We will definitely be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: markandjeremy
Reviews.Content: Being used to small rooms in Paris hotels our bright modern large room was a treat. The hotel staff are welcoming and the location is great for the Metro and Gar Du Nord. Not a great deal of interest in the vicinity but quite easy to reach the key sites from here.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located near a metro station: quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: ilgah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this place through tripadvisor's reviews. I agree about the location: it is excellent, tucked away on a dead end street (nice and quiet), yet near the metro station. We ended up on the top floor, the room had skylights with the best window blinds ever: it was so dark that we slept way past our normal wake up time! That was wonderful. The room was tiny but we found it fine as we were only in there when sleeping. I was disappointed we had to pay for internet connection for our laptop. We liked that there was a lot of things to do in the area (restaurants etc). We never tried the breakfast as we wanted to check out the food around the city. We found the front staff to be very friendly and helpful. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: krazee1000
Reviews.Content: Good location. But you need to change at least once to get to the main sights from the closest metro stations. Friendly front desk staff. Clean and modern room. Has a lift/elevator. Breakfast staff were ok but could have been more friendly. No wifi, high speed wired internet was good but you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “My bedroom in Paris”
Reviews.Author: roboterpirat
Reviews.Content: Absolutely worth the money - truly friendly and helpful staff, very clean (but tiny) rooms and a Metro station some 50 metres from the hotel. Only things to criticize: the lack of a heater in the bathroom and the bed: three blankets but no really warm one. Still, if I head to Paris again I'll definitely visit the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value--modern and clean with great location”
Reviews.Author: Neconoir
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific, located inside a 'mews' like side road with no through traffic and right around the corner from Grand Boulevard metro station. Very easy to walk to north for Montmartre or south to Marais, Notre Dame, Palais Royal. 10 minute cab from Gare du Nord if taking Eurostar. Plus, it really is quiet and shielded from road noise. Lots of restaurants on the same road and not the usual tourist traps. Usually plenty of people around in the restaurants on Grand Boulevard till late at night, so felt safe coming back late. Inside, it's just been renovated and well done. Everything looks clean, stylish and simple. The hardwood floors are a nice touch--though because this is a 2 star, you are still going to hear some noise from other rooms, especially in the mornings when people are packing to check out. So this is not a place to sleep in until noon. The first room we had was really tiny--no room if you have anything bigger than a carry-on luggage. It also faced the front, which suffered some noise in the mornings from garbage pickup trucks. The second room was on a higher floor and faced the back--no view, but larger (reasonably for Paris) and more manageable for two people if staying for more than a couple of nights. Staff was lovely--particularly Ms Fang, who spoke English. Very happy to help and assist. We didn't experience any surly service as we have before in other Paris hotels. One of the bigger lifts I've seen in Paris, so no problem for those who can't climb stairs. No free wireless was a disappointment, only paid and cable access, requiring a laptop. No computer in the lobby for printing out boarding passes. If you're particular, would suggest bringing toiletries, as you just get soap and packets of bodywash/shampoo. Breakfast is just cereals, croissant/bread & jam, coffee & juice. Nothing fancy. Overall, this is a truly excellent value for a 2 star hotel in Paris. Probably the best I've found in my many trips to Paris and very well suited for a weekend break in from Eurostar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: apmech1
Reviews.Content: I was met with a smile, a ready room and a friendly voice. My wife and I stayed here for just one night before moving on in our journey, but the room was clean, large, with a large bathroom and shower. Veronique was the gem of the stay, with her humor, her attentiveness to detail and general helpfulness. Stay here agin? You bet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: igorniko
Reviews.Content: That was the first time I had been to Paris. The city was so beautiful, a memoriable trip of mine. Stayed four nights at de la cite Rougemont. It's a very nice hotel with clean room that I'd stayed in, decent price in Paris. The bed was comfortable, good sleep. The staff was honest and friendly. I'll come back Paris and stayed there again definitely. I love both.

Reviews.Title: “Great little "out of the way" hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ecraft66
Reviews.Content: We were so surprised at the cleanliness and up-to-date bedding and bathroom. Conveniently located near the Grands Boulevard metro stop, we could get anywhere in the city with a short ride. The hotel was just off a busy street, tucked away from the noise of the city. The hotel staff were attentive and helpful. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaimi44
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms and very, very clean. Breakfast 6 Euros was bread, coffee, juice and cereal - not terrific but okay. Only had it one day. Would have liked a way to have hot water for tea or coffee in the room. Charging extra for WiFi seemed excessive to me. Nice location and quiet with easy access to metro, bus and strolling around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Clean beautiful rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Mlarnold
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Clean beautiful rooms (small but I don't mind that at all). We didn't have breakfast but there is a great little cafe around the corner (cafe marguerite) w free wifi but get there early or all the chocolate croissants will be sold out! All of the employees speak v fluent english and are so friendly and helpful We will definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with clean rooms and a decent price”
Reviews.Author: oblivion6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, amazing location. 15 min walk down to the seine near the louvre and with the underground pretty much right outside you can get to anywhere in central paris in minutes. Also we went out to eurodisney for the day and this was only about a 45 min trip. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels and the staff were always helpful and friendly. My only critiscm of the room was that the TV had no english channels, but given that in Paris your room should only be used to pass out after a days walking, drinking and eating this is no big deal :)

Reviews.Title: “silent and convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ralext
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this nice hotel for 3 nights - 3 min from metro, silent, very clean, safety box in the room, very friendly staff and reasonable price - very recommend if you want to save money amd still be in a city center. Approximately 20 min walk to Des Halles, Monmartre or Madelene.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived at desk and was told moved me to a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melvon
Reviews.Content: Suck! After 16hrs on the plane and ready to check in for a rest. Worker makes mistake on cancellation and put me to a different 2 stars hotel. Push my baggages a few blocks to another hotel with disappointment. On a noisy street and no internet access. I think because I booked at a cheaper price, they gave my room away without informing me. Even we have traded emails on my confirmation and actually told me how to get to the hotel from airport. This is totally unacceptable!! Looking for ways to complaint to the association of hotels in France.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DTKC2010
Reviews.Content: I was very leary on what to expect when arriving at this hotel, especially since it isn't on booking.com, but I was certainly pleased with what we got. The lady on reception was super nice and immediately upgrated our room from a single quadrouple room to a two room attached, which was terrific. Yes the rooms were very small but everything was brand new and super clean. Lots of hot water, lots of water pressure, quiet location, comfy beds... I slept awesome, all four of us did. The metro is right there, also lots of places to eat, a grocery store and a parking garage... although it was one of the more expensive ones. If you want internet, from what I understand you have to have a laptop and you can plug in. No wireless but there is apparently an internet cafe near by. We didn't have the breakfast but it was only 6 euro for the adults and the kids were free. Not sure what it consisted of as we chose to go to McDonalds up the street. So in conclusion, our stay at the Cite Rougement was certainly worth the 103 euros and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Solemne
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean and nicy, it has a very good location in the center of paris and it is important that the neighborhood is nice and you have a subway station just 1 minute from there. What I found very important is that the service is kind and speaks different languages, being argentinean, me and my familiy could have a personal attention in spanish, that helps a lot when you do not know the city at all. We really enjoy those days in paris and we recommend this hotel, as for us we will be back in the future, thats for sure !! Familia Germigniani

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: A380SIA
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which is in a quiet location, has been recently refurbished and this makes the rooms modern and clean although compact. The in-room safe is very handy for your documents. We have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions and the service is always friendly, helpful and down-to-earth. We arrived mid-morning after 20 hours' flying, a room was prepared for us in minutes and we were offered a coffee while waiting. The Metro is only a couple of minutes away and the Opera and major shops a 15 minute stroll away. Online booking was easy and efficient. If you're not leaving Paris until later in the day, baggage can be left in the hotel - just let reception know and they will show you where to put your bags. There are cash machines, restaurants and supermarkets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Central and great . . .”
Reviews.Author: Richardpukimak
Reviews.Content: recently renovated rooms, friendly reception, quiet location, near a metro station, family atmosphere, helpful and accommodating. Great for a weekend break...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de la cite Rougemont
HotelInfo.Address: 4, cite Rougemont | 09 Arr., 75009 Paris, France
